info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 2:45PM EST until March 07 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. The highest snow amounts will be across the higher terrain from southwest Bradford County to Luzerne County, where isolated higher amounts are possible. * WHERE...Bradford, Wyoming, Lackawanna and Luzerne counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour at times late tonight into the pre-dawn hours Tuesday. The snow will avoid the peak evening and morning commuting hours, though some effects will linger after the snowfall ends.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be found at 511ny.org or 511pa.com. Or, dial 5 1 1.
